abstract.text: Associates a data item type with an element.

inlineContent.text: attribute to associate the data item’s type with a particular
The string value associated with the
property in the associated data item.

abstract.text: Use Apple TV Markup Language to create individual pages inside of a client-server
app.
Displays a spinning indicator and a title.
Displays important information to the user.
Contains information about where a media item is stored.
Plays background audio for a full-page template when the template is the top-most
document in the navigation stack.
Specifies that the element should initially be in focus.
Control background images and media items that play in the background.
A small image displayed alongside or on top of another image.
Displays information along the top of a TVML page.
Provide initial descriptive information for other
elements.
Associates information in a data item with an element.
Implement binding and impove DOM manipulation options.
Displays a button icon the user can click to initiate an action.
Creates a button that can also have a badge associated with it.
Creates a generic element with its contained elements arranged through TVML styles.
Arranges images in a row.
Displays groups of items along one side of a page and images of a group’s contents
on the other side.
Contains other layout elements.
Displays information about a single media item and its components.
Displays a date.
Displays images inside of other elements.
Displays text that describes a displayed element.
Displays multiple lines of text.
Displays large amounts of important information to the user.
Display a visual element, such as an image, badge, or progress overlay.
Provides the ability to create pages that don’t conform to a layout defined by another
template.
Contains information displayed at the bottom of an element.
Provides the ability to gather information from the user.
Displays an image over an entire element.
Arranges elements in a grid pattern.
Contains information displayed at the bottom of an element.
Displays an image that is usually large and detailed.
Displays information about an artist or performer.
Displays an image.
Contains several images to be displayed at a later time.
Displays grouped sets of information.
Displays
element information in a vertical format.
Group and display content in the form best suited for the information.
Displays contained element information in a vertical format, with each successive
element directly below the previous element.
Displays information associated with an element.
Organize and display multiple elements in a structured layout.
Specifies the direction in which text is displayed.
Creates a generic container.
Contains a new list item.
Displays a list of items along one side of a page and the corresponding image on
the other side.
Displays a spinner and description on the screen.
Contains several elements that are treated as a single element.
Combine several elements so that they can be treated as a single
element.
Displays user options for a media item.
Contains information used to play inline audio or video.
Displays menu items along the top of the screen.
Creates a page with items along the top and related information below.
Displays information below a
element.
Creates a monogram using a person’s image or initials.
Provide the user the ability to stream audio and search for information stored
on a server.
Displays information about currently playing audio.
Creates a page that allows users to navigate between full-screen images.
Displays a number.
Creates a generic element with its contained elements arranged through TVML styles.
Displays elements on top of other elements.
Displays a groups of items along one side of a page and scrolling images on the other
side.
Contains elements that are not directly evaluated by the template.
Displays information for a group of related media items.
Contains general information about a product.
Displays detailed information about a single product.
Places a progress bar on top of another element.
Defines a group of elements that can be reused through binding.
Displays an image used to rate a product.
Contains rating information about a product.
Displays a rating for an item.
Contains elements that are related to another element.
Contains the URL for the displayed content.
Displays abbreviated review information for a media item.
Displays elements horizontally.
Contains the elements used in data binding and media queries.
Displays an interactive text field used to search for content.
Searches for a media item based on user input.
Displays an image that indicates the season for an associated media item.
Combines elements and acts as a single element.
Displays a list of segment bar items.
Displays information above a segment bar.
Provides titles inside of a segment bar.
Displays a horizontal line.
Displays elements horizontally and adds the ability to scroll to offscreen elements.
Displays images the user can navigate between.
Implements queries used for data binding.
Groups and lays out elements vertically.
Displays groups of products.
Draws a line through the designated text.
Displays text below the subtitle’s containing element.
Displays text on the screen.
Display text onscreen.
Displays text associated with an image.
Displays a text field the user can interact with.
Sets the color scheme for an element.
Displays a short amount of text.
Displays a list of
elements.
Contains title information for a tumbler header.
